name: Condesa Apartment in 1920s Landmarked Art Nouveau Mansion
description:
This newly redecorated (after these photos were taken) one bedroom loft style apartment is an addition to a 1920s landmarked Art Nouveau mansion. It has large shared outdoor areas and is in a safe tree lined park filled area with lots of restaurant and shopping options.

The mansion is a pleasant 15 minute walk from the museums in the Bosque de Chapultepec (Museo de Arte Moderno, Museo Tamayo, Castillo de Chapultepec, the world famous Museo de Antropologia e Historia, etc.) A pleseant 3 minute walk from Parque Mexico and Parque Espana. 2 blocks from Palacio de Hierro department store. Well connected to subway and metrobus lines. There's a large supermarket 2 blocks away as well. Everything you'll need from shopping to dinning or entertainment, is conveniently near as well as upscale gyms and yoga schools. The house is an oasis of tranquility in the middle of a bustling, exciting city. A perfect place to rest and recharge your batteries after work or sightseeing.
<
neighborhood_overview: Stroll in Parque Mexico and Parque Espana, just 3 minutes from this apartment on the border of the trendy Condesa and Roma districts. These safe, attractive neighborhoods boast tree-lined streets, fountains, and many dining and shopping options.
host_about: HI!  I'm from New York.  Came to Mexico 20 years ago to play French Horn in the orchestra here.  Loved the country (still do), hated the orchestras.  I've been giving voice lessons for about the last 15 years.  Mostly musical comedy.  I'm home oriented, love to cook.  Do lots of yoga.  Love to be a tour guide to help people explore this amazing city.

name: 2 bedroom apt. deco bldg, Condesa
description:
Comfortably furnished, sunny, 2 bedroom apt., on the second floor, Colonia Condesa.

The space
Comfortably furnished, sunny, 2 bedroom apt., on the second floor, Colonia Condesa. One bedroom has a queen size bed, the other, 1 single. We're located around the corner from both Parque Mexico and Av. Insurgentes.
The apt. is in a 1940 vintage Art Deco apt. building, and has been restored, preserving the hardwood floors and much original detail. The kitchen is fully equipped (this is our home, not a rental flat) and linens are provided. There is a large TV, DVD, stereo with ipod hookup, wifi, laundry on roof. We're located in a safe, quiet part of Condesa, 1 block from the metrobus (Sonora), a multiplex cinema and mall, Parque MÃ©xico, many restaurants and bars. A modern supermarket as well as a traditional Mexican market are both 4 blocks away, and there are exquisite street markets on Tuesdays and Fridays.
We do not charge a cleaning fee - no surprise
neighborhood_overview: sin registro
host_about:
I am a journalist writing about food, (book and blog: Good Food in Mexico City).  The 'deco apartment' I rent is my own, the other, 'luxury' flat is that of my best friend - I help rent it for her as she is not as computer and English savvy. I am not an agent!

My partner and I do a lot of traveling: We have been to Spain, France, Holland, Turkey, Greece, India, Cuba, Ecuador, China, Bangladesh. and all over Southeast Asia. Oh, and the  United States.

name: Beautiful light Studio Coyoacan- full equipped !
description:
COYOACAN designer studio quiet & safe! well equipped; super fast internet. Neighbor to Frida & Trotsky; Close to the main square; 5 mins walk to museums, the Coyoacan market, cafes & bars! Eco friendly & private with its own patio & roof garden. Short and now long-term rental available! Experience, the market, the restaurants and cafes or cook at home. Your base in this great city. 5 minutes walk to the Cineteca, you will be staying a location of filmmakers, but who are dedicated to our guests.

The space
LIGHT, SPACIOUS, QUIET, FRIENDLY LOCATION. YOU WILL ARRIVE IN MEXICO CITY TO A BEAUTIFUL HOME AWAY FROM HOME. THESE APARTMENTS HAVE EVERYTHING ONE MIGHT NEED, RELIABLE FAST WIRELESS INTERNET LAUNDRY ON THE PREMISES, CLEANING and BED AND TOWEL CHANGE ONCE A WEEK. CLOSE TO TO THE CASA AZUL, FRIDA'S HOUSE IN COYOACAN. SITUATED ON A QUIET SAFE STREET. TEN MINUTES WALK TO THE SUBWAY. AROUND THE CORNER IS THE FAMOUS COYOACAN MARKET AND SQUARE WITH ARTISAN STORES,
neighborhood_overview: Coyoacan is a beautiful neighborhood famous for its artists and for artisanal ice creams! Fantastic little cafe's and street life. Wonderful market, Frida and Trotsky around the corner. Its safe and quiet. Near Viveros, a wonderful class where one can run, walk, join a Tai Chi class, or watch the bullfighters practice with each other.. ( not with bulls!) like a choreographed ballet in the open air. Close to Roma and Condesa but without the noise of the city and without the pollution. Visit Cineteca only 5 minutes walk with its multi screens showing Mexican and International movies, with its cafe's and out door screen.
host_about: I am a mother, documentary film maker and photo curator, originally from England but today live in  Mexico City. I love design, art, photography (movies of course) meeting new people and hosting the apartments. Coyoacan is an amazing neighborhood and it gives me pleasure in introducing our guests to places I have discovered over time. We love sharing with our visitors at the same time respecting their total privacy, I have been a super host now for over 5 years... and take pride in taking care of our guests. It matters! I have had some not so good experiences traveling myself and so all the more reason to make the stay for our visitors the best possible.

name: Stay like a local in Roma Norte
description:
Our beautiful century-old house is perfectly situated for exploring the city: we're half a block from Metro Insurgentes, there is a bike share station across the street, and Ubers usually arrive within minutes. Super comfy bed, private balcony and bath. We love sharing our home with guests and helping guide them to the best spots in the Mexico City.

The space
_________________________

Our house was built in 1905 with gorgeous colonial features: high ceilings, hardwood floors, lots and lots of light! The room is located at the front of the house, and we live in the back, so there is plenty of privacy for our guests even though it's a shared house. Our office is a short walk away, and a friend has a vintage clothing store in the bottom floor of the building, so there's usually someone here in case of a lockout or any questions that might arise.

Guest access
Guests have access to their bedroom and private bath, the living room, dini
neighborhood_overview:
_________________________

Roma Norte, as you've probably already read, is full of cafes, galleries, quaint parks, etc. It's safe and beautiful. Our neighborhood was built by the aristocracy of Mexico City in the late 1800s / early 1900s, and the colonial architecture remains. Roma suffered quite a bit of damage following the earthquake of 1985 (as well as in 2018), but in the past decade has seen a rapid revitalization and the opening of many of the city's best restaurants and galleries. We're just a quick walk from Condesa, another beautiful neighborhood with lots to see and do. Colonia Juarez is also up-and-coming, and just 3 blocks away.
host_about: I am a graphic designer from southern Virginia who somehow found my way to Mexico City. My husband Jorge and I love to travel, and we enjoy meeting new people from around the world. I'm a little food-obsessed, and he's a little art / culture-obsessed, so I think we're a good pair to host visitors to this dynamic city.

neighborhood_overview: Enveloped by a vintage air, Narvarte serenely lingers in the past at the southern edge of the city. PapelerÃ­as, tlapalerÃ­as, and ferreterÃ­as opened during DF's construction boom in the mid-20th century continue to serve decades-long loyal customers. During the same boom, Japanese, Lebanese, and German immigrants moved into the area. Many still call Narvarte home and their diverse tastes flavor the neighborhood with a welcomed cultural richness.

On our street "Allende" you will find, in addition to the market, various restaurants such as "El Morral", "Villa Coral", the "TaquerÃ­a Los Parados" as well as convenience stores, souvenirs, clothing stores, and much more .

Upon reaching the center of CoyoacÃ¡n you will find the church of "San Juan Bautista", the Craft Market and multiple options of recommended restaurants and bars, such as "La Coyoacana", "CorazÃ³n de Maguey" and "Los Danzantes".

host_about:
We are Hector and Anaid, we are friendly and kind. We both are Archaelogist and enjoy taking our guests to archaeological tours, mainly to the great pyramids of Teotihuacan. 
We love to receive guests in our house, meet new people, and make new friends from around the world. 
We enjoy talking about and many different topics with our guests, we love to share the history of our country. 
We like to learn about our guests cultures, holidays, life and always keeping an enviroment of harmony, peace and joy in the house. Every guest is different and a different experience, and our goal is to try to convert their stay with us into a experience they can remember with happiness. 
We know we are not the best, but with every guest, we learn new things and try to be better each time. 
Sometimes depending of our guests, schedules and plans, we try to integrate with them, maybe a dinner, or going out somewhere for shopping, museums, events, or anything.

In San Rafael you will find the San Cosme market where you can do your shopping for cooking.

Villa Mural is a centric urban space conformed by charming outdoor spaces and 6 comfortable accommodations; 5 one-bedroom apartments & 1 studio, which are available for one-month-minimum stays, for travelers who seek a place to stay at during their work / study trip to Mexico City.

The space
Our property represents a destination by itself. This cozy one-bedroom apartment is one of the 6 units that conform Villa Mural, a magnificent urban villa located within what is known to be the "geographical center" of Mexico City. It is currently the most original lodging concept in town.

Upon staying at this comfortable accommodation, you will be able to enjoy a peaceful and private space within an environment where you will also be able to meet other travelers from around the world and exchange with them valuable impressions and recommendations. Moreover, you will live the experience like a local of this fascinating metropolis, enjoying both your own private spa
neighborhood_overview:
The Escandon neighborhood was founded in the early 19th century and was part of the Hacienda de la Condesa, and it is divided into 2 sections: Escandon I & Escandon II. Villa Mural pertains to the first. We are located within what is known to be "the geographical center of the metropolitan area" which gives our guests a chance to move faster and more easily in any direction.

In our immediate area, there are all kinds of businesses within a 5 block radius: several convenience stores or as we call them "corner shops"; the Escandon local market with all kinds of fresh produce; restaurants, coffee shops & bakeries; pharmacy stores; banks with ATM machines; barber shops; and even a fire department, a police department and a church just around the corner. The Escandon is, in short, a centric and accessible neighborhood, with all kinds of services at your fingertips.

You can also walk to the Metropoli Patriotismo shopping mall, located a bit over one kilometer away, and
host_about:
If you're anything like us, then you most likely love to travel around the world, savoring the most extraordinary foods and wines and encountering all the amazing spots a new place has to offer out-of-towners.

Without a doubt, you also enjoy getting to feel the essence of a vernacular culture while staying at high-end, luxurious, centrally located, comfortable retreats. But most importantly, I bet you really prefer doing so without having to pay the price tag for all you are receiving and that's what we call being a "Smart Travel Decision Maker".

Well, we have some very good news for you today, since our splendid "Non-Smoking Residencies and Studios" located at the heart of MexicoÂ´s capital, are all about that and had been recently made accessible to savvy travelers like you. 

Hi there! We are Jorge & Monnah and we really like to make new friends, especially people from outside Mexico.  We've been traveling around the world for quite some time now. We are a family of 4 currently living in breath-taking CancÃºn, MEXICO. We have this marvelous properties in Mexico City that we really love for its history in our family and every time we go to our Big City, we enjoy enormously staying at any of them. We love and enjoy MÃ©xico City like few other places in the whole world. These unique accommodations are available now with all sort of amenities and services to assure a comfortable stay to our important guests. We are very accommodating hosts so if any of our guests needs anything, we are always willing to help; so please don't hesitate to ask...

We're sure that you and your travel companions will also enjoy your next trip to Mexico the way you never anticipated, should you resolve to come over and stay at any of our gorgeous properties. So we encourage you to make yourself your own "Smart Travel Decision" and enjoy your upcoming adventure in wonderful MÃ©xico City like you never thought possible by making our home your home. 

Mi casa es su casa!

Sincerely, 

Jorge & Monnah

name: Beautiful Colonia Roma apartment
description:
The space
Beautiful apartment in Edificio Ajusco, an iconic 19th century Colonial building located in the heart of Colonia Roma (Plaza Luis Cabrera).

The neighborhood is know as the bohemian "barrio" of DF and has been the main attraction to generations of artists, writers and urban hipsters. The building is just footsteps to a number of shops, restaurants, galleries, parks and museums, and is walking distance to the happening Colonia Condesa, and within a mile to the charming Chapultepec park and Polanco area.

The building preserves its Neo-Colonial architecture and style with a mix of Porfirian, French, and Roman elements including its central patio, high roofs, wooden flooring, carved frames, and cast iron details, all within a quiet/peaceful atmosphere. It was pronounced as cultural heritage of the city by INBA.

I'm Marco. I am a graphic designer, but I also love photography, food, and especially traveling. I have been to a lot of cool places and met some great people, who have in turn visited me in Mexico City. I decided to formalize my "crash pad" and open it up to travelers on airbnb. In the best part of the city! Cats and children in the house. May be noisy in the mornings. Matress is very firm, some people may not like it. Do not book if you can't follow rules or haven't read the whole ad.

The space
Come live in a classic HOUSE in the Napoles district, one of the most exclusive in the city. 2.5 bathrooms are shared between all 6 guests. Great for students, couples and professionals. The place is well maintained and right in the middle of it all! It's located in a quiet street too. You can see the WTC Mexico building from your window. You have access to the back garden, tables and chairs available to facilitate distancing. There's a flea market on Sundays that sells delicious food and every product you can think of, Nearby, on weekdays, there are
neighborhood_overview:
The food, The people, The Views, and More:

Good gastronomic selection.

You can pick up pizza on your way here from the metrobus station, have tacos, tortas, pizzas, or go to the flea market on Sundays and buy fresh meat, fruit, or movies.

Clean, and safe area, full of trees, beautiful classic houses, a pretty park (Alabama and New York) and modern buildings. There's a nice view everywhere you turn.

Nice, friendly, and warm people. You will find top notch businesses here, superama, movie theaters, computer stores. There is always something to do, someone to meet, somewhere to go.

The iconic Polyforum Siqueiros, which contains the largest mural ever made is a 5 minute walk from the house. The WTC (formerly known as the Mexico Hotel) is right next to that. You can shop at supermarkets, or flea/farmers markets (where you can find incredibly fresh food, sun-glasses, ipod chargers, you name it). There are shopping malls, movie theaters,

name: Descansa en la Suite de la Abuelita San Angel CDMX
description:
Beautiful, spacious and calm independent Suite on ground floor, fully decorated with Mexican hands&crafts, with a comfortable kingsize bed, 800 threads sheets. Small dinning room. Bathroom with bathtub. Kitchennette.
Free WiFi, complimentary full breakfast and daily cleaning.
Located inside our ArtistÂ´s Residence, our guests can enjoy our common spaces: dinning room, living rooms, roof deck with BBQ and fire pit (available upon request for you and your friends).

The space
When you walk in our Residence, with 5 independent studios or suites, you can feel the decoration of San Angel, 100 years ago, combined with todayÂ´s comfort.
During your stay, you will walk through our Mexican Contemporary Art Collection, of paintings, prints, sculpture and photography.
For example, the tiles of our floors were created in the traditional way in Oaxaca, designed by contemporary artists such as Francisco Toledo or Mauricio Cervantes.
Our guests will e
neighborhood_overview:
San Ãngel is a XVI century village nestled in the big Mexico City: its architecture is lovely and still preserve beautiful houses and gardens, and its safe to walk around its unique small alleys and secret spots.

During the Viceroyalty in the XVI - XVIII centuries, San Angel was the perfect place for country homes to rest from the city.

Walking distance, you will find several museums as the Carrillo Gil Modern Art Museum, the Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo Studio Museum, the gorgeous Ex-Convento del Carmen Museum, the Mexican Revolutions Museum, la Casa del Risco or the Isidro Fabela House.

You cannot miss the Bazaar del SÃ¡bado, on Saturdays... just 2 blocks away in Plaza San Jacinto, where local artists and all-around-the-country handcrafts market promenade is really enjoyable.

Other nice neighborhoods as Coyoacan or Chimalistac, and the main campus of UNAM (National University) are close enough to visit plenty of cultural spots as the fantas
host_about:
We are a mexican couple who has been together for more than 25 years. We have two teenagers: a daughter, a son.
We are in the IT business and we love to travel. We always travel as if it was the last trip of our lives. For us, family, love and harmony are essential in life. We enjoy contemporary art and we are dedicated to promoting mexican artists and culture in every place we visit. 
Pancho and I met scuba diving in 1994, therefore the sea, nature and outdoor activities are basic and necessary. We enjoy camping, scuba diving and sailing, sport in which we compete every month in Acapulco.
Lunch time is a special moment for us, a pause where we can enjoy and celebrate being together, a moment apart from the rush of the city where we prepare ourselves for the afternoon daily commitments.
We love Mexico and we are ambassadors of our country, we always talk about how great is the mexican spirit, its culture, gastronomy, nature, beaches and its history. If we had to choose another country to live, it would be Italy for the same reasons we love Mexico.
We recognize ourselves as entrepreneurs because of our professional upbringing, we generate projects and ideas, some of which become business ventures. We've always been motivated by the risk, investing time, money and effort to develop new ideas with a purposeful end. Another factor deeply rooted in our family is ecology and self sustainability and seek to have the least possible impact on our environment and our planet .
We have a francophile part because the 4 of Pancho's grandparents were born in France and married in Mexico . With some friends, we spontaneously create an amateur theater group fifteen years ago, "ThÃ©Ã¢tre a la DÃ©rive", where we enjoy making plays in French just for the pleasure of the whole process, costumes, learning the script and friendship. The group is composed mainly by frenchies living in MÃ©xico.
Today what bring us here is that 14 years ago, on a sabathical year, we lived in a "Chateau" in France countryside, and we opened 11 rooms to host our beloved...  more than a hundred friends and family members came to visit and stayed with us in that 12th century castle. The uniqueness of this experience led us to replicate the model in Mexico, and we open our home with a project: Art Residence to share it with you, people with similar interests, that want to enjoy living among art in our village of San Angel,  town founded 500 years ago and today immersed in one of the largest and most exciting cities in the world: Mexico City. Welcome!

In our country we say to our guests: "Mi casa es tu casa. My home is your home".

Great located 1BR apartment. Room has a queen size bed. 1 full bathrooms. High speed internet (250 m). Fully furnished. TV in the living room. Balcony to have a coffee break and take a little sun. The apartment has a washing machine and drying machine.
The building has a small gym, security 24/7, 1 parking space, and a roof garden.
A cleaning lady comes once a week if rented for 7 days.

The space
The place a is a fully furnished cozy apartment decorated in a simple and personal style. I keep books here of cinema, traveling and some novels. The living room has a nice surround system for watching a movie and there is a balcony for smoking or taking a chair out and relaxing.
The place is one block away from the metro station, one block from the supermarket and other amenities like Starbucks, some fast food and many typical restaurants and cafÃ©s! Also most main avenues in this area of the city are a couple of blocks away. So it's also easy to find y
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood remains really quiet throughout the night, by day the noise from RevoluciÃ³n is barely noted so this won't be a problem. The area has a lot of diversity of people and businesses, from having some restaurants around to small typical Mexican food places.
A metro station is one block away which is useful to move around the city, the orange line takes you to Auditorio and Polanco, also near San Angel for the Saturdays market.The supermarket is one block away and also in that plaza there are some fast food places, a nice sushi place and Starbucks. Passing the metro station there is the Mixcoac market which is a typical Mexican market that sell cheaper food and fruits, the sea food is delicious over there!
host_about: Hello. Miguel from Mexico city! I work as a freelance among some other things. Really like to travel, sports, and cinema. I enjoy meeting a lot new cultures and different people. :)

The space
Villa Alfonsina
Enjoy one of the most emblematic and traditional places of MÃ©xico in a 160 years old house. The House "Villa Alfonsina", located in the heart of Coyoacan is the ideal place for travelers and students from around the world seeking harmony, comfort, peace and a friendly atmosphere in the style of Spanish Moorish architecture and amenities of modern life.
Each room has anything you need for short term stay but also for long term stays.

This is the Biggest Room in the house. Perfect for long t
neighborhood_overview:
Our prime location offers great benefits. Located just in front from Frida KahloÂ´s Museum, home of the famous Mexican artist known worldwide for her works and transcendent life.
That corner is also a Mexico City "Turibus" (Tourist Bus) Stop. Which with only one ticket can take you to visit some of the most wonderful places on the Mexico City.
We are only two blocks from the known Market of Coyoacan, and only four blocks from the Coyoacan Downtown, where during the colonial period, the first Town Hall, and the first Novohispanic goverment was set.
Today a traditional place, forced to be visited, where you can find many facilities such as restaurants, bars, libraries, the traditional coffee "El Jarocho" , the crafts market and the museums of Leon Trotsky, the Museum of Popular Culture, and the Church of San Juan Bautista.
host_about:
We are Hector and Anaid, we are friendly and kind. We both are Archaelogist and enjoy taking our guests to archaeological tours, mainly to the great pyramids of Teotihuacan. 
We love to receive guests in our house, meet new people, and make new friends from around the world. 
We enjoy talking about and many different topics with our guests, we love to share the history of our country. 
We like to learn about our guests cultures, holidays, life and always keeping an enviroment of harmony, peace and joy in the house. Every guest is different and a different experience, and our goal is to try to convert their stay with us into a experience they can remember with happiness. 
We know we are not the best, but with every guest, we learn new things and try to be better each time. 
Sometimes depending of our guests, schedules and plans, we try to integrate with them, maybe a dinner, or going out somewhere for shopping, museums, events, or anything.

name: Cozzy Studio In Condesa, Mexico DF
description:
Beautiful sunny studio walking distance to the subway and rental bikes (ecobici), located in a little street in the heart of Condesa. Walking distance to restaurants, shops, gyms, parks.
Fully Furnished and equipped, new dryer-washer. Ready to move in.

The space
I have owned this studio for 10 years, and I have redesigned the interiors myself when I used to live in the apartment. Since I lived it I designed it for it to be comfortable, homey and ideal for long and short stays alike.

It is very well kept, very cozzy any time of the year. My furniture is mostly hand made, designed by me or chosen by me. It is truly a unique space to live and feel just like home. There is a beautiful collection of plants "inside garden" that makes the space feel very zen. Everyone who stays here always tell me they feels like home, (check out are great reviews!) and I always make sure to help in any way possible! I love hosting :) Welcome to your home away from h
neighborhood_overview:
It is a small street in Condesa, far away from the buzz of restaurants, but still at walking distance if you want to be part of the night life. It is a residential street. Very well located. The subway is two blocks away, and the rental bike station is just in the corner. The supermarkets, gyms and parks are very close by, there is a miscellaneous shop where they sell fresh fruit and other produce (cash only), there is also a few hospitals very near by for any kind of emergency.
This apartment is great for anyone who wants to live the true Mexico City experience without the need of renting a car or depending on one. Condesa is one of the hippest areas in Mexico City.
host_about: I like to host! Have always wanted to have a little bed&Breakfast, but meanwhile I rent my little studio and make sure everyone feels welcome and feels at home. I have a great attention to detail and like to make the extra effort for everything to be 100% ! I love to travel, and meet new people from all over the world. I have been renting my studio for 5 years now and it has been a great experience.

name: Central Roma Norte
description:
Welcome to Mexico City and welcome to Roma (or Roma Norte as it's now called). This flat is a bit of an Aladdin's den (nothing is stolen). I have inherited a lot of the art on the walls, along with my own collection, and I'm super happy to share it with you. The place was recently done up in a fun style, and I've fitted it with a working kitchen since I like to cook when I travel. I've also added some plants.
I hope you enjoy the light and decor of each area.
Teseo, your host.

The space
This private room is the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. With its ample space, you won't feel cramped or confined, but instead will be able to stretch out and truly make yourself at home. The room features a large window that brings in plenty of natural light, making it a warm and inviting space to relax in.

But the best part of this room is its location at the back of the building. With its peaceful and quiet surroundings, you'll be ab
neighborhood_overview:
Colonia Roma, located in Mexico City, is a historic neighborhood known for its rich cultural heritage and eclectic architecture. The area was developed in the late 19th and early 20th centuries and quickly became a hub for Mexico's cultural and intellectual elite. In its early days, Colonia Roma was home to many of Mexico's leading artists, writers, and intellectuals, who were drawn to the neighborhood's vibrant cultural scene and its reputation as a center for progressive thought.

One of the most distinctive features of Colonia Roma is its architecture, which is a mixture of styles from different eras. From Art Nouveau buildings to Art Deco structures and everything in between, Colonia Roma is a feast for the eyes for anyone who appreciates architecture and design.

However, despite its rich cultural heritage and vibrant artistic scene, Colonia Roma has faced its share of challenges over the years. In the mid-20th century, the neighborhood fell into disrepair as m

I'm a writer and photographer. I've gone to school in London and upstate New York. 
Love to travel. 
Im a writer by trade and I guess my house reflects this, its large, but suited for one person since Im almost always alone here (gonna make this evident in the photos) Also there is a ton of Â¨stuffÂ¨ I like things and the walls and shelves can attest to it, so no minimalist that freak out with clutter. 

Love music, rockabilly punk being the favs, but Salsa to classical will do too... techno, not so much. 
I've stayed in so many peoples houses that this site seems just like a good way to spread the dharma around!
take care.

name: Very cool apartment with terrace in Roma Norte
description:
Located at one of the most interesting neighborhoods, surrounded by trendy restaurants, art galleries and coffee shops. It's style, location and easy acces, make of this sun filled duplex an attractive option if you come either for work or fun !!

The space
THE APARTMENT
This Art Deco duplex is 1,300 ft2 and has two bedrooms, one bathroom and an office that opens onto a private terrace with deck chairs, a hammock and lots of sun (our guests tipically cite the terrace is the main reason they picked our place !!). Most of our furniture is restored original mid 20th century. The apartment's high ceilings and wide spaces make it fresh in the summertime, and its multiple windows let in the sunshine during winter. The kitchen is nicely equipped with everything you need to cook. Lots of space and style in the best location.

THE NEIGHBORHOOD
Colonia Roma was developed as one of the most elegant places in the city at the beginning of last century.
neighborhood_overview: Colonia Roma is a diverse, middle-class area, with markets, shops, and some of the most sophisticated dining destinations and galleries in town, plus mansions from before the 1910 Revolution. One of the city's best restaurants is only a block away.
host_about: We think Mexico City is a great place to visit. During these seven years Airbnb has given us the opportunity to help our guests live as locals and discover what our neighborhood and city have to offer. Just as soon as we have a reserve we send our guests lists of recommendations of things to do and our favorite restaurants. If you have a particular interest, we will be happy to answer your questions.

Anzures Neighborhood is located in on the most touristic and centric areas in Mexico city. Some of the main attractions in the area are the traditional Bosque the Chapultepec, shopping avenue Presidente Mazarik in Polanco,La casa del Lago, Chapultepec castle, the Anthropology National Museum, The Modern art Museum, Tamayo museum among others. Mostly by a walkable distance.

Just a few steps from Paseo de la Reforma street where converge Condesa Roma, CuahutÃ©moc and Juarez Neighborhoods.

Very easy access to Downtown by foot if you are a good walker or taking a bus just across the street, 5 minutes distance to Metro Chapultepec metro station and near to eco bike stations.

You will also find a whole variety of restaurants, hotels, cafes, theaters etc. WeÂ´ll provide a list of our favorite ones!

name: In the heart of La Condesa
description:
A comfortable place with a great location, just a few blocks from the public transportation. Restaurants, coffees, parks and attractions are really close to here...

The space
It is a cozy place where you're gonna feel like home.
neighborhood_overview: It is a great neighborhood filled with green areas, beautiful architecture and good bars and restaurants. Here you can feel safe, you can walk or take a bike to many cool places in the city. Being a centric area everything feels really close.
host_about:
I am visual content creator and photographer in a content studio named Ryoko... 

I love travelling, meeting new people, sharing ideas, taste new food, shooting photographies, walking new ways and enjoy life. I really love getting involved into other cultures. I will suggest you the best places in town :) 

Me as a traveller: 
I am always planning a new trip. Since I started to travel by myself I never have been in a hotel. I prefer to get along with local people, see how they use to live. I always prefer to visit different places an not the usuals or touristic spaces of the cities. When I am in a new city I use to get out and start walking without direction and discover places by myself. I keep the maps in my bag and doesn't matter if I get lost, I like to recognize all the places around,  the streets,  the details, see everything that is posible, and find by myself all the different ways to get back home...  I have a lot of good memories in all the places I have visisted. I find the beauty of each city in the people that I met and in all the experiences that I have there, those are the first things that come to my mind when I think in some place, the rest comes apart. 
I don't want to be a tourist, I just want to make mine every place I visit. 

Favorite places: Chacahua, Oaxaca. Mexico, City, Chiapas, Mexico. New York, Paris, Ghent, Belgium. Sweeden, Tokyo, Berlin! 

Me as a guest: 
I am always trying to live new experiences.  I had experiencies with another ways to lodging and all them have been amazing. I just read about this project "Airbnb" and I found it great and denfinetily I knew that I had to try it. 
I'm very independent, most of the time I am out of the house. When there is time I like to get along with my hosts but also I am so respectful with your space, I'm very very very clean and orderly. I don't smoke. We can talk about music, movies, trips, books... I love sharing music. 
I am food lover, I receive all kind of suggestions! 

Interests:
The Knife, Likke Li, Laura Marling, LCD Soundsystem, Russian Red, Gorillaz, CocoRosie, Crystal Castles, Santigold, Coconut Records, Beirut, KOC, Calle 13, Royksopp, etc...
Mad Men, Breaking Bad, Community... 


Learn all you can, go wherever you can...

neighborhood_overview:
Enveloped by a vintage air, Narvarte serenely lingers in the past at the southern edge of the city. PapelerÃ­as, tlapalerÃ­as, and ferreterÃ­as opened during DF's construction boom in the mid-20th century continue to serve decades-long loyal customers. During the same boom, Japanese, Lebanese, and German immigrants moved into the area. Many still call Narvarte home and their diverse tastes flavor the neighborhood with a welcomed cultural richness.

NOTE: 
Years ago when creating an profile on AIRBNB, it was required to add a personal photo and to write a brief description (BIO) or ourselves (as HOST and/or GUEST). / Now this seems to have changed and some individuals that don't have it, forget that we're opening our homes and want to know a bit of who's coming.

Some don't provide an official ID, are new at AIRBNB  or haven't been active in a while, therefore they don't have a REVIEW.

neighborhood_overview: Coyoacan is a place to be immediately immersed in culture, color and tradition. By simply walking through its plazas and small cobbled streets you step back in time. The location could not be better with its museums, squares, churches, markets and that special ambience of old colonial grandeur and indigenous charm that Coyoacan proudly presents. With the advantage of our close metro station you can get to the centre of Mexico City and experience all the wonders of the historic quarters, the museum areas, the vast shopping and later return back to the peaceful cobbled streets of good old Coyoacan. It is said that people who live in Coyoacan never wish to leave. I guess our dear Frida Kahlo could not agree more.
host_about: I am madly in love with my good old Mexico and all its charm. I direct a youth ballet company (Ballet Joven ) so dance, music, culture and cats are my sort of things. Welcome to Coyoacan, you will be delighted! Bienvenidos!

name: 4B - Suite Bazaar San Angel (1BR/1BA Double)
description:
Welcome to San Angel: Mexico City's most stylish and charming neighbourhood. With a tradition that goes back to our grandparents Juan and Cristina Solorzano, we look forward to welcome you into our beautiful home. Find your own green oasis in the big city by entering to our house and its lush garden. History meets modern in this fully equipped suite ready for your arrival (fresh linen, fully equipped kitchen), cable TV, wifi, and other amenities await you.

The space
San Angel is one of Mexico Cityâs quietest, stylish, and charming neighbourhoods. Our fully furnished suite offers an oasis from the cityâs busy environment. The property is built around a beautiful landscaped large garden that offers a peaceful and calm experience. Recharge your energies at the end of the day or start with a cup of coffee enjoying the sunshine in the lush grounds.

Afterwards, go for a stroll on the pebble-stoned narrow streets of San Angel. Enjoy this charming little tow
neighborhood_overview:
San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

Mexico Cityâs Secretary of Tourism recently named the San Angel neighborhood a Barrio Magico (Magic Neighborhood). San Angel, located 12km (7.4 miles) southwest of the historic center, was once a retreat for wealthy city residents. Cobblestone streets, plazas, gardens and elegant estates are reminiscent of the neighborhoodâs rich colonial past.

San Angel is home to monuments, historic residences, a former Dominican monastery, a cultural center housed in what was once a municipal palace and several interesting museums. Among them are the Risco House Museum (Plaza San Jacinto 15) with its impressive 18th century talavera tile fountain, the Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo Studio Museum (Diego Rivera 2 and Altavista 4) and the Anahuacalli Museum (C
host_about: My name is Juan Gabriel Solorzano and I am a Mexican Architecht who has lived in San Angel all his life. I know this neighbourhood well, and it is with great pride that I welcome guests here. As an architect, I pay special attention to the design and functionality of space. I trust you will find in my place a combination of comfort and elegance. I particularly enjoy landscape architecture and have built lush gardens into my properties.  What I like most form Airbnb is the opportunity to show guests a little bit of the Mexico that I love.

Our street "Allende" is privileged as it is only two blocks from the CoyoacÃ¡n traditional market, where there are several food options and 4 blocks from the center of CoyoacÃ¡n, the most emblematic place in our area.

On our street "Allende" you will find, in addition to the market, various restaurants such as "El Morral", "Villa Coral", the "TaquerÃ­a Los Parados" as well as convenience stores, souvenirs, clothing stores, and much more .

Upon reaching the center of CoyoacÃ¡n you will find the church of "San Juan Bautista", the Craft Market and multiple options of recommended restaurants and bars, such as "La Coyoacana", "CorazÃ³n de Maguey" and "Los Danzantes".

There is cultural entertainment nearby, such as the "Centenario Theater" which is only 5 minutes away on foot, and "La Capilla Theater" which is 8 minutes away.

We are also close to various
host_about:
We are Hector and Anaid, we are friendly and kind. We both are Archaelogist and enjoy taking our guests to archaeological tours, mainly to the great pyramids of Teotihuacan. 
We love to receive guests in our house, meet new people, and make new friends from around the world. 
We enjoy talking about and many different topics with our guests, we love to share the history of our country. 
We like to learn about our guests cultures, holidays, life and always keeping an enviroment of harmony, peace and joy in the house. Every guest is different and a different experience, and our goal is to try to convert their stay with us into a experience they can remember with happiness. 
We know we are not the best, but with every guest, we learn new things and try to be better each time. 
Sometimes depending of our guests, schedules and plans, we try to integrate with them, maybe a dinner, or going out somewhere for shopping, museums, events, or anything.

Small department located in the roof of our house which is near the center of Coyoacan in Mexico City.
We are within a walking distances from UNAM and 10 minutes away from the subway.
1 Individual bed, 1 complete bathroom, 1 work table, 1 drawer and 1 bookshelf.

IMPORTANT: You have to be able to get your stuff to the roof in very tiny stairs.
The internet may be slower but you have the option to go downstairs next to the modem so you get better Wifi.

The space
Our charming house was built in the 50's by my beautiful grandmother. We have remodel around the house so it is nice for everyone. Our departments are great for students around the world and for normal travelers that want to know Mexico City.
Here is a list for our amenities!

-bookshelf and a little drawer for your clothes.

-Fresh bed linens provided. We lay out towels, travel size shampoo and shower gel on each room.

- *Initial round* of
neighborhood_overview:
Coyoacan, is a very beautiful neighborhood, it is very colorful and traditional part of Mexico City. We have a lot of museums, restaurants, craftsmarkets to buy traditional art to take back home, bars and big malls too. You will love Coyoacan for sure.

Our neighborhood is very save, we have security cameras all around and there is good lighting at night if you ever have to walk pass regular hours.

name: Lighted room with private bathroom
description:
We are a young French/Mexican couple who work in the film industry. When we can't travel, we loved to meet people from different horizons (close or far).
San Pedro de los Pinos, a quiet and traditional neighborhood, is near to Condesa (5 min by taxi).
Metro station is two blocks away.
We have two loving dogs (a whippet and a street dog - German shepherd-ish).
Lightly room full of DVD (and big screen) if watching movie is you thing. You have your own bathroom.

The space
Very clean place (free cleaning three time a week).
Free breakfast.
200 MB internet
You can rent the whole flat if you want to.

Guest access
You can relax in the living room and eat/cook in our well supplied kitchen. We also have a little studio which is perfect if you are looking for a quiet place to work in.

Other things to note
We are located very near Revolution avenue: can be noisy sometimes.

name: Apartment with spectacular view
description:
The apartment has an outstanding view with dining and living-rooms, two bedrooms with complete toilets and a big kitchen. It is located in one of the most exclusive areas in Mexio City. Experience the country side feeling in a big city!

The space
The house has been just remodeled so the toilets and the kitchen are new. The size of the apartment it is enough to make you feel comfortable. Each room has a closet to keep enough clothes. The main room has a walking closet next to the toilet and another closet in the room. The second room has its own toilet and a closet in the room with enough space.
The main room, the living and the dining rooms face south and this is great orientation because it has a lot of light and the temperature is perfect. There will be fans at the house if you feel hot but I am sure that you wonÂ´t feel cold.
At the back of the house there is a garden and also a small forest which is a federal area. This will make you feel like if
neighborhood_overview: The Neighborhood Lomas de Chapultepec is one of the most exclusive in Mexico City. It is very safety and calm. The house is located a walking distance of the street Prado Norte where you can find many stores, restaurants, pharmacies, grocery stores and a market. It is also next to Palmas Avenue where there are all the banks, restaurants and stores. The neighborhood Las Lomas is near Polanco which is also a nice and popular area. It is no far from the historical city center, if you are interested to visit this area.

If you are a tourist, there isnÂ´t a more convenient place like Paseo de la Reforma.

The space

Paseo de la Reforma is an avenue that incites precisely to âPasearâ which means to walk around without being afraid of getting lost. From the Independence Statue, better known as âThe Angelâ you just might have an encounter with Marathons, manifestations, festivals, parades, massive meditations or worldwide celebrations.
A âPaseoâ on Reforma is like an inmerssion in the culture, enjoying the trees, Street art expressions, habits and characters and diverse multi sense experience that only MÃ©xico City can provide.
host_about:
Welcome to my world.  IÂ´m a people person and have shared my place with friends from London, Germany, Finland, Japan, Spain, France and USA. 
I am very proud of MexicoÂ´s heritage and cultural background and would love to share it with you. I work as a free lance communication consultant and I also enjoy practicing and teaching meditation and some other ancestral healing traditions. My place is warm, friendly and cozy.  If you choose to stay here I could help you design or optimize your stay in MÃ©xico City and join you or drive you around if you feel like it. If you (Hidden by Airbnb) where my flat is you will see that you are within walking distance from some of the most interesting sites like Chapultepec Castle and Park, Modern Art Museum, The Anthropologic Museum, Tamayo. And you can easily and safely walk move around day or nigh since this is a very privileged area. Wether you choose to stay here or not, I hope you have an amazing time while in Mexico.

I have always thought I am a good host, respecting space and cooking breakfast whenever I can (I don't cook, but I buy a croissant from the bakery across the street like nobody else). 

This thing is telling me to put my life motto here but I'm not sure I have one so I'll just say I HATE bugs. Any other questions or whatever, I'm always free for a chat... :)

neighborhood_overview: Mexico City's Centro HistÃ³rico is a place that can not be defined with just one world. Magical, could be, but not even that world woulb be enough to talk about its enigmatic personality. It's like a mosaic scene in constant change of a colorful kaleidoscope where they converge an variety of cultures, traditions, architecures, artistics movementes, etc. Visiting this city means visiting a lot of destinations, all of them coexisting in harmony that interwaves in its streets, its people, its tourists as well as its buildings, parades, festivals. They are many words and experiences in just one place, in different instants. Between one instant to another the experience you may have will be completely different. That's Mexico City. That's why it would never be enough find it a description. You have to live it.

description:
Enjoy this peaceful, completely private and upgraded bedroom at my house. Located in one of the best residential neighborhoods in the south of the city, this is a safe, quiet place minutes away from shopping, restaurants & transportation. Ideally located for students looking for long term stays! WiFi/parking included.
To accomodate larger groups I have another bedroom in the house that can accomodate up to 2 more guests: https://es.airbnb.com/rooms/7886849?preview

The space
Welcome to my home!
My house is nestled in a quiet residential neighborhood, close enough to great restaurants, shops and quick transportation, but far enough so you can have a great night sleep in a safe, family friendly environment. With a charming park view from your window and my small back garden, my place is great for a convenient overnight stay or for students looking for long term housing to attend any of the universities located nearby.
My guests will enjoy a private,
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is mostly residential and very safe, but that doesn't mean it lacks food and entertainment options! A few blocks away from the house you can find various types of restaurants from typical mexican "comida corrida" spots, to sushi, hamburgers, bakeries and multiple street food carts. Also a few blocks away we have a big shopping mall, super markets and many public transportation stops that can take you to the typical touristic destinations.
For students, Tec de Monterrey University is a 5 minute bus ride, as well as UAM and even UVM has it's South campus nearby.
For more traditionally touristic destinations, we are closely located to the famous Xochimilco neighborhood where you can ride typical trajineras while listening to floating mariachi bands and eating mexican street food.
If you have questions or are interested in specific locations please don't hesitate to ask me!

Bilingual-bicultural hostess with expertise about Mexico City. Super location, 5-10 minute walk from museums, parks, shopping, restaurants, and transportation. Internet, cable t.v., once a week cleaning service, use of kitchen facilities included.

The space
Very clean, private, practical, and at the same time there is access to the host family if so desired. Kitchen facilites close by.

Guest access
Private room with bath. Access to kitchen facilities and terrace. Personal laundry services available with fee.

Other things to note
The location is superb. One half block from Masaryk, walking distance to all major shopping, Palacio de Hierro, Antara, Plaza Carso, museums, Chapultepec park, National Auditorium, many of the cities best restaurants, metro, public transportation and ecobici stations. Polanco is one of the safest areas in the country.
neighborhood_overview: The best of Mexico City right outside your door.  Walking distance from Plaza Carso, Antara, National Auditorium, Chapultepec Part, Bike paths, public transportation, Reforma Avenue, hotels, spas, restaurants and night clubs.
host_about: Somewhere between Mary Poppins and Don Quijote .......... positive, happy and outgoing.  Passionate about Mexico City and its surroundings ..... enjoy yoga, biking, cultural events and travel.

description:

Everything you could need is steps away. there is a 24 hour doorman and the apartment is on the 4th floor

The space
everything is just a few years old, with an outdoor balcony (great natural light all day) and in the heart of the roma norte neighborhood, and a 24 hour security guard at the front door

Guest access
washer/dryer, internet, telephone

brand new dinnerware, and i believe everything you will need for a comfortable stay....including a 24 hour guard...

name: Great Location! Â¡Beatiful and Clean! Security 24/7
description:
One bedroom and Two toilets apartment. WIFI 50Mbs. Confortable place with big bedroom. Close to major city sights. Angel de Independencia, Museums, hisorical monuments, Zocalo; walking distance to best areas: Roma, Condesa, Polanco; 2 minutes from US Embassy. 3 minutes walk to all public transportation (subway, bus, taxi), shopping centers, grocery shops. 24/7 Security Doorman/reception. Elevator, Wifi, confy Queen-bed. Spacious 70sqmeters. Non-smoking place. Elevator.

The space
Everything is placed it to make you feel as home. A nice and clean bathroom and one aditional separated toilet. High-speed wifi. Full equiped kitchen with microwave, toaster, coffe maker and any you may need. Fridge, washing/dryer machine. Satelital TV. Very clean.

Other things to note
We sanitize

Shops, restaurants, galleries, museums, night clubs, grocery stores, all public transportation. Close to most touristic atractions. All roads leads to our neighborhood, literally!!
host_about:
My name is Manuel. I'm an independent professional. I love traveling around the globe whenever is possible, make new friends and enjoy life, just like you do. I have stayed for long terms in diffrent countries and my experience have thought me what a traveler really needs and want while traveling. YouÂ´ll notice.  

I may meet you when you arrive to make sure you feel comfortable in the place, then I left and you just have to enjoy the space and the neighborhood.

In case you have any question or want some good advice about the city, you just have to call, text, (Hidden by Airbnb) or email me and I will be more than happy to help.

Looking forward to meeting you and welcome to Mexico City!!!

Manuel

name: Rustic room for rent
description:

Guest access

Free WiFi, complimentary full breakfast and daily cleaning.
Located inside our ArtistÂ´s Residence, our guests can enjoy our common spaces: dinning room, living rooms, roof deck with BBQ and fire pit (available upon request for you and your friends).

The space
When you walk in our Residence, with 5 independent studios or suites, you can feel the decoration of San Angel, 100 years ago, combined with todayÂ´s comfort.
During your stay, you will walk through our Mexican Contemporary Art Collection, of paintings, prints, sculpture and photography.
For example, the tiles of our floors were created in the traditional way in Oaxaca, designed by contemporary artists such as Francisco Toledo or Mauricio Cervante
neighborhood_overview:
San Ãngel is a XVI century village nestled in the big Mexico City: its architecture is lovely and still preserve beautiful houses and gardens, and its safe to walk around its unique small alleys and secret spots.

During the Viceroyalty in the XVI - XVIII centuries, San Angel was the perfect place for country homes to rest from the city.

Walking distance, you will find several museums as the Carrillo Gil Modern Art Museum, the Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo Studio Museum, the gorgeous Ex-Convento del Carmen Museum, the Mexican Revolutions Museum, la Casa del Risco or the Isidro Fabela House.

You cannot miss the Bazaar del SÃ¡bado, on Saturdays... just 2 blocks away in Plaza San Jacinto, where local artists and all-around-the-country handcrafts market promenade is really enjoyable.

Other nice neighborhoods as Coyoacan or Chimalistac, and the main campus of UNAM (National University) are close enough to visit plenty of cultural spots as the fantas
host_about:
We are a mexican couple who has been together for more than 25 years. We have two teenagers: a daughter, a son.
We are in the IT business and we love to travel. We always travel as if it was the last trip of our lives. For us, family, love and harmony are essential in life. We enjoy contemporary art and we are dedicated to promoting mexican artists and culture in every place we visit. 
Pancho and I met scuba diving in 1994, therefore the sea, nature and outdoor activities are basic and necessary. We enjoy camping, scuba diving and sailing, sport in which we compete every month in Acapulco.
Lunch time is a special moment for us, a pause where we can enjoy and celebrate being together, a moment apart from the rush of the city where we prepare ourselves for the afternoon daily commitments.
We love Mexico and we are ambassadors of our country, we always talk about how great is the mexican spirit, its culture, gastronomy, nature, beaches and its history. If we had to choose another country to live, it would be Italy for the same reasons we love Mexico.
We recognize ourselves as entrepreneurs because of our professional upbringing, we generate projects and ideas, some of which become business ventures. We've always been motivated by the risk, investing time, money and effort to develop new ideas with a purposeful end. Another factor deeply rooted in our family is ecology and self sustainability and seek to have the least possible impact on our environment and our planet .
We have a francophile part because the 4 of Pancho's grandparents were born in France and married in Mexico . With some friends, we spontaneously create an amateur theater group fifteen years ago, "ThÃ©Ã¢tre a la DÃ©rive", where we enjoy making plays in French just for the pleasure of the whole process, costumes, learning the script and friendship. The group is composed mainly by frenchies living in MÃ©xico.
Today what bring us here is that 14 years ago, on a sabathical year, we lived in a "Chateau" in France countryside, and we opened 11 rooms to host our beloved...  more than a hundred friends and family members came to visit and stayed with us in that 12th century castle. The uniqueness of this experience led us to replicate the model in Mexico, and we open our home with a project: Art Residence to share it with you, people with similar interests, that want to enjoy living among art in our village of San Angel,  town founded 500 years ago and today immersed in one of the largest and most exciting cities in the world: Mexico City. Welcome!

In our country we say to our guests: "Mi casa es tu casa. My home is your home".

It is ideal for a weekend getaway to experience Mexico City or to attend business.

The space
Fully equipped modern decoration apartment with superb location in one of the safest most central spots in the city at the frontier of the Aztec empire and modern Mexico City just blocks away from historic district and right next to major museums and landmarks at the business district. Location is ideal to visit both old Mexico (Bellas Artes Museum, Chapultepec) as well as modern (Polanco and Reforma avenue) and art districts (Condesa and Roma). Short walking distance from subway and public transportation including city tour bus to the rest of the city as well as various restaurants and bars.
neighborhood_overview:
Northeast is Mexico Cityâs âHistoric Districtâ which dates back to the 13th century Aztec Empire and thru the Spanish 16th century colonial age. At the Zocalo plaza, just a few streets east of the apartment, you will find the remains of the Aztec emperor Moctezumaâs temple next to the National Palace, the official government residence that thrives with artist Diego Riveraâs murals and the monumental Cathedral built on top of the pagan temple, symbol of Mexican religious devotion and Spanish conquest. As you walk thru the streets of the district you will experience centuries of history along with live shows, people dressed in traditional outfits, original architecture and amazing cuisine.

Northwest is modern Mexico City. Along Reforma avenue is the financial district with modern architecture and malls. Further west is Chapultepec Forest that houses the colonial age viceroy residence. Going west of the apartment there are colonia Roma and Condesa, which are considered th

name: CONDESA - Home away from home!
description:
Ideal opportunity to stay at a classic Mexican style home located in one of the trendiest neighborhoods in town while living the unique home sharing Airbnb experience. Just a few street blocks from all convenient services: public transportation, the hop on/hop off tourist bus, neighborhood cafes and clubs, landmarks, supermarkets, bakeries, shops, and parks. We also offer airport pickups and a variety of safe, convenient and tailored door to door bilingual tours. Live Mexico city to the full!!

The space
Our home is welcoming, friendly and very respectful of your relaxation time. Best place to stay after a busy day.
The place is big enough for comfortable and independent home sharing. My partner and I live in a separated section of the same house, and we offer two independent and comfortable private bedrooms that include their own private bathrooms and the use of common areas. I will always be ready to assist you when required.
At home, we can comforta
neighborhood_overview:
One of the trendiest, safeties and most interesting neighborhoods in town. Close to everything you may need.
Condesa is considered to be one of the most fashionable neighborhoods in Mexico City, especially among young businesspeople, artists, students and others. Its character has been compared to that of the Soho in New York and the Latin Quarter in Paris. Its avenues are wide and lined with trees. It is mostly residential but also filled with restaurants, cafÃ©s, boutiques and art galleries. While the area has been residential for over 100 years, its âBohemian" character has only been in existence since late 1980s. Condesa has a number of examples of older Art Deco and Art Nouveau architecture, as well as innovative modern designs. Walking distance from main museums and landmarks. An experience youâll never forget
host_about:
Hello and welcome to our home.  Leo and I will be glad to share our place with you during your visit to Mexico City, and make you feel at home. We really like meeting people from all cardinal points. We have travelled to different countries and this is why we understand what you need. Leo is a dentist and I am a business consultant. We speak Spanish, English, French and Portuguese. Communication is not a problem. We love learning about different cultures and sharing ours. We are so proud to live in one of the biggest and most modern cities of the world. 
We like to listen to all kinds of music, attend concerts, visit museums and landmarks, watch all type of films, go to theater plays and in general take advantage of all the diverse extensive cultural activities the city has to offer. Come and join in the fun!
As your hosts, we will share special tips to help you live as a local in one of the trendiest and best located neighborhoods in town. Don't miss it!

name: Private Room âEl Buen Tono (JuÃ¡rez)
description:
Nice corner house about 100 years old. Part of the Buen Tono Housing complex. Its perfectly located in the edges of 4 interesting neighborhoods in DF: JuÃ¡rez, Roma, Centro and Doctores. The market, ecobici and Metro station are right in front.

The space
Beautiful corner house built in 1913 for the 'Buen Tono' Tobbaco Company. The space is clean, airy and well lit. Interior/Exterior and tall ceilings. The room is in the back of the house, with its own patio and complete bathroom. It's pretty cozy and quiet.

Guest access
Direct door to the street. The guest will received a set of keys.
neighborhood_overview:
Colonia JuÃ¡rez is one of the oldest and most beautiful neighborhoods in central Mexico City. The neighborhood is shaped like a long triangle with the boundaries: Paseo de la Reforma on the north, Avenida Chapultepec on the south, and Eje 1 Poniente (Avenida Bucareli) on the east.

With palacios dating back to the Porfiriato period next to modern buildings and quiet streets lined with trees, the colonia is divided into 3 different quartes:
Korea Town (with lots of good eateries and karaoke spots)
Zona Rosa (Gay clubs, theaters and Reforma Avenue)
Barrio Gitano (the most residential area, where the spot is located)
Its pretty chill and safe. Young and old.
host_about: Im a 29 y.o. architect from Oaxaca. Currently live and work in DF, where I manage a mexican electronic music label. Im used to host a lot of different artists. I'll make sure to give you the best tips on the city to make your stay more memorable.

ItÂ´s a place that always feels alive, surrounded by restaurants, cafes, theaters, museums, Chapultepec Park, Polanco and Condesa.
host_about:
Welcome to my world.  IÂ´m a people person and have shared my place with friends from London, Germany, Finland, Japan, Spain, France and USA. 
I am very proud of MexicoÂ´s heritage and cultural background and would love to share it with you. I work as a free lance communication consultant and I also enjoy practicing and teaching meditation and some other ancestral healing traditions. My place is warm, friendly and cozy.  If you choose to stay here I could help you design or optimize your stay in MÃ©xico City and join you or drive you around if you feel like it. If you (Hidden by Airbnb) where my flat is you will see that you are within walking distance from some of the most interesting sites like Chapultepec Castle and Park, Modern Art Museum, The Anthropologic Museum, Tamayo. And you can easily and safely walk move around day or nigh since this is a very privileged area. Wether you choose to stay here or not, I hope you have an amazing time while in Mexico.

description:

Flat is in a totally refurbished and charming 1950âs building, 2 blocks from Plaza Luis Cabrera and Alvaro ObregÃ³n. Fully equipped kitchen, wifi, cable tv, appliances, 24hr security. Flat is on the third
neighborhood_overview:
Roma Norte is the go-to place in Mexico City. Everything is walkable, and it's full of great restaurants, bars.
It was urbanised in the 1900s as an extension of the City Centre, and still keeps lots of original buildings (have a look at the local architecture guide in the flat). It has recently undergone an extensive redevelopment to become one of the trendiest and hippest areas. It has become a focal point for art, culture, markets, bookshops, and quite a variety of bakeries, local & gourmet restaurants and bars, gourmet shops & markets, without losing its local charm. Art & crafts fairs take place every few weeks in the area and you can also do some vintage shopping and visit art galleries. Even though the neighbourhood is full of great bars and restaurants it still manages to be quiet and calm.
There are 2 supermarkets, 5 and 7 blocks away, and there are several mini-supermarkets within 100 metres distance, offering basic groceries, fruit and household items. There is als
host_about: Mexican architect dedicated to urban development & architectural preservation. Keen traveller, art & museums addict,  foodie, wine & football lover.  I love Mexico City, I think it is a thriving & exciting city, with incredible diversity and variety of activities, and Roma Norte is the perfect spot to explore it from. Looking forward to be your host and  share with you all my tips of this amazing city!

We also have an office with high-speed internet (150 Mbps of internet speed), a l
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood:
Colonia Roma Norte, or âLa Roma,â as we locals call it, is one of the hippest neighborhoods in the city and has some of the best examples of art nouveau, art deco, eclectic and French architecture in the country. Take a stroll or bike around the neighborhood and youâll find everything from old-school bookstores and ice cream parlors to trendy clothing boutiques and amazing cafÃ©s and art galleries. There are great restaurants for every taste and budget where you can try the most traditional Mexican dishes as well as the tastiest international cuisine.

As for the nightlife, this might be the most exciting place in Mexico City, with fantastic cocktail and wine bars and even some speakeasies. Artists and bohemians from all over Mexico and abroad love La Roma. We promise you will too!

neighborhood_overview:
Colonia Roma is a neighborhood that dates from the end of 19th century and early 20th century. Despite the strong transformations it had faced it still retains many houses and buildings of its best time with âPorfirian architecture, wich represents a great legacy now days for Mexico City and this have made the district return and emerge as an atractive, centric, and trendy neibourhood.
La colonia Roma and colonia HipÃ³dromo-Condesa is a very demanded area and greatly appreciated for their centricity, its wooded spaces in streets, parks and avenues with an alternative atmosphere wich placed them as our "Village". Predominates young population, creative, artists from various branches, designers, producers, models etc. There is great variety of gastronomic offers for all tastes and budgets. Bars of different environments, cafÃ©s, gourmet shops, hairdressers, gyms, shops of decoration and furniture stores, book shops, supermarkets, retayling stores, hospitals, drugstores...
Also
host_about:
I am a good person. I am 48 years old. I am quiet, homey, educated, responsable, I am concerned to do the right things so everyone is happy. I was born in the year 68. Sign: Leo.  I am artist, dance flamenco for 23 years, though I am dedicated to the logoterapy-psicoterapy, I love swimming and I practice it regularly. I like to spend time with my family.

* Traveling: trips that I've liked most had been "road trips". Travel a couple of hours on the road, find the historical centres of cities or walking arround small towns, enjoy the local gastronomy, landscapes, views, and make another trip to visit or spend the night in another town. Visit national parks, beaches and countryside. Also, I like visit museums, go to the tourist attractions and have chance to go to the theatre, ballet or that goes on. I also love cruises and ski holidays.

* Countries: my favorite country is Spain, the style of life, its gastronomy, its regions and natural beauties, its contrasts and itss people 
I love Europe. I studied in England and Scotland when I was 17/18 years old, so  I'm an Anglophile's too. 
I also love Portugal, France, Italy, Switzerland, Croatia, Germany and the Scandinavian countries 
I love to visit someday the Greek Islands. Turkey, Poland, and other regions of France and Italy that I've still been missing  as Brittany, Normandy, La Provence, La cÃ³te du Rhone, or la Calabria, Sicily and Sardinia...  
Iâve also got fascinated by the French Polynesia. 
New Zealand, Australia and Japan are of my favorite countries in other continets,as well as  Hong Kong, Singapore, Thailand and Indonesia.   
I like the United States, specially New York, San Francisco, Boston and Miami. I also loved Canada, but I still missing the West Coast.
In Latin America I like, especially, Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Costa Rica and I would like to visit Colombia.  

* In the gourmet aspect, I love I love Spanish gastronomy. Also French cuisine, Japanese, Italian and the Mexican. 
* I couldnât not live without flamenco, without my beloved ones, without swimming lessons, without travelling and enjoy good food and the pleasures of life. 
* Books. The ones I like most are the biographical of great men and wome in history, for example: "Winston Churchill", "HernÃ¡n Cortez", Felipe II, Francisco I, "Maximiliano and Carlota", "Porfirio DÃ­az", "Enrique VIII and his six wives". "Elizabeht I, Mary Queen of Scots". on the other hand: "The Dorian Gray Portrait", "Another twist", "Crime and punishment", "The dog in the manger", "la Celestina", "flowers in the attic,"the night is Virgin","friends that I lost, "was yesterday and I don't remember", "existential psychotherapy"and "The gift of therapy" of Yalom, among others.  * Films. 
* Favorite films. "Dangerous Liassons", "Devil were's Prada", "Te doy mis ojos", "La Comunidad", "American Beauty" "Mujeres al borde de un ataque de nervios", "Somewhere in Time", Anne of the Thousand days", "The Others", "The Sound of Music", "The Shining", "Shindrel List" "Fried Green Tomatoes", "Coma", "El hada ignorante", "The Queen", "El hijo de la novia", "Elsa y Fred", "Camila, "The Black Swan", "Nosotros los Nobles", "Como agua para Chocolate" "The Graduate", "Little Miss Sunshine". "Transamerica"....
*Tv shows. "Downton Abby", "Breaking Bad", "Miss Marple",  "Gran Hotel", "Club de Cuervos, "The Forsyte Saga", The Nanny"...
* My favorite dishes: Iberian ham, baby squid in its ink, abanda rice, Wellington fillet, eels, fabada, salami, fondue, spaghetti Carbonara", Vienershnitzel, good burgers, sandwiches or gourmet snacks, and Mexican tacos. Desserts: custard, homemade flan napolitano, Santiago cake, Nantes, Missippi Mug foot, the apfell strudel, profiteroles, crepes Suzette, cherries jubilee, arroz con leche, Catalan creme, the marzipan and nougat.
* As guest I consider myself to be very  clean, tidy, formal, responsable, not noisy. I do like confort and cleaness, a peaceful and not noisy enviroment, kindness and gentleness, a good firm bed, a nice pillow, black out, TV system and WiFi, and sometimes central heating, a fan or A/C if  necessary.
* As host I like to please my guests as much as posible. I like to do my best so they could feel very confortable and satisfied. Iâd like to know their purpose of their stay and the type of holidays, interests or kind of food they like, if they are vegeterian or not, If they come for pleasure or for work,  if they need some special requirments in other to find out locations or sites they might find important for their stay.

* Quotes that I like: 
"Blessed are those who know how to give without remembering it and receive without forgetting it".
 "Blessed are the men of good will".
 "Never despair still in direst distress, because of dark clouds fall fertilizing and clean water." 
"The limits of my language are the limits of my world."  
âA master is made by practice".
 "Bizarre is our condition here on Earth. Each of us comes for a short visit without knowing why, yet sometimes we believe guess a purpose". Albert Einstein 
"The largest democracies weakness is economic fear." Albert Einstein
 "if what you say is not more beautiful than silence, not tell". Arab proverb. 
 "All the passions are good while one owns them and all of them are bad when enslave us." 
"If all the bad people were black and all the good white, from what color would you be?... because I would have striped skin."

serveral pharmacies around (5-10 min).

The MERCADO DE LA ESCANDON is just 5 min away. It opens every day. Good for food (small restaurants, comida corrida) or fruit, veggies.

there are several small restaurants or taco-places around. Also at night.

name: Outstanding,  spacious, 3-bedroom gem in Condesa
description:
In the heart of Condesa, on a quiet street, the apartment features the most contemporary tasteful interior in the area, in addition to a highly secure and monitored environment.

It is close to everything you need: restaurants, shops, bars, food stores, parks with a children's playground.

When you book, I send my Welcome Guide with practical advice and tips about the apartment and the city. Past guests have found it very helpful to plan their trip.

The space
--Ground floor
--3 bedrooms, 2 with queen beds, one with 2 twin beds
--2 of the bedrooms have tables for work
--high speed WiFi, 200 mbps
--2 bathrooms / with toiletries
--living room, dining area and kitchen are all integrated
--beautiful hammered marble floors
--WiFi, English/Spanish TV, speaker plug-in for cellphone
-- fully equipped kitchen, with dishwasher
--dining area with glass skylight, also perfect for home office
--windows op
neighborhood_overview:
Eclectic, nostalgic, and beautiful, Condesa is one of the special treasures of Mexico City., recently voted the #1 city in the world to visit. Strolling under giant trees, centered on landscaped boulevards, access to bakeries, top-level open air restaurants, bars, shops, specialty food and liquor stores, are within easy walking distance.

Condesa is a mixture of Art Deco, Spanish and modern architecture creating an adventure around every turn, a place that offers a more gentle time along with the vibrancy of contemporary life. With two beautiful parks and endless variety, you'll fall in love with a local flavor that's old and new, totally intertwined.

name: Boutique Apartment Alameda
description: Quite apartment at the heart of Mexico City (close to Palacio de Bellas Artes, a few blocks away from Zocalo, close to Bellas Artes's and Juarez's subway). neighborhood_overview: Mexico City's Centro HistÃ³rico is a place that can not be defined with just one world. Magical, could be, but not even that world woulb be enough to talk about its enigmatic personality. It's like a mosaic scene in constant change of a colorful kaleidoscope where they converge an variety of cultures, traditions, architecures, artistics movementes, etc. Visiting this city means visiting a lot of destinations, all of them coexisting in harmony that interwaves in its streets, its people, its tourists as well as its buildings, parades, festivals. They are many words and experiences in just one place, in different instants. Between one instant to another the experience you may have will be completely different. That's Mexico City. That's why it would never be enough find it a description. You have to live it.

name: Snake Room
description:
Welcome home, welcome to Mexico! This is my home, a space that I like to share. It is quiet, bright and welcoming, in the neighborhood you will find everything you need, bakeries, cafes, restaurants, authentic Mexican food and stores, libraries, parks, art, cultural and tourist spaces.
5 minute walk from well known neighborhoods like la condesa and la roma where there is a great gastronomic offer.
This apartment is full of life and made with love.

The space
Come and enjoy in this beautiful apartment full of light and love, my purpose is for you to feel at home and enjoy your stay and the city.

I share my home with other travelers, for now I no longer live here but it is still the home that I have lovingly designed.

Now guests enjoy it and it is a space to meet new people and share experiences in a warm and friendly atmosphere.

The apartment and the rooms are quite large giving space and privacy to each guest.
neighborhood_overview: Escandon is the name of our neighborhood before it was part of the courtyards of La Condesa and today is a neighborhood located in the middle of all places of tourist interest while maintaining the authenticity of a Mexican neighborhood, the market is on Tuesdays on the street jose martÃ­ there you will find shops of all kinds authentic, unique and rich if it is food. Around us there are vegan places, old and delicious restaurants, typical Mexican Cantina, cheap food restaurants, good cafes, bakeries, a park and an endless number of places of interest that you will discover.
host_about:
Welcome to my profile.

Im a traveler offering travelers a home in the city.
Im a creative being working with brands as an art director and photographer.

I live part time in the city, part time in the world and part time in my van.

Follow my accounts to know more about me and my places.

IG
Grecia Erives
The Mexican living

The area consists of three colonies: the Colonia Condesa, the Colonia HipÃ³dromo and the Colonia HipÃ³dromo Condesa, and is well known for its large number of cafes, bookstores, restaurants, galleries, and boutiques, as well as its cultural and nightlife. The Colonia Condesa shares her border and bohemian spirit with Colonia Roma, and together they form the so-called Cultural Corridor Roma Condesa.
